title: Raise rstest to 0.18.0
body: This eliminates a transitive dev dependency on syn-1.0

title: Use EV_ONESHOT.
body:
So tokio-file can be used by a multithreaded tokio runtime.

See also https://github.com/tokio-rs/tokio/issues/4728

title: Eliminate vulnerability in the remove_dir_all crate
body: It was transitively pulled in by tempfile.  This change should not affect regular users of tokio-file, just developers.

title: Update rstest to 0.16.0
body:
Because older versions using deprecated
semicolon-in-expression-position syntax.

title: The error type of all futures is now io::Result.
body: This should make consumers' builds less dependent on the precise version of Nix in use.

title: During CI, install cargo-audit from pkg instead of compiling from source
Rewrite the internals for better efficiency.
Add a benchmark based on Tokio's AsyncReadExt trait
body:
This trait uses threaded I/O under the hood.  It currently runs about
12x slower than tokio-file's AIO-based reads.

title: Raise the MSRV to 1.49.0
body: Tokio did it, so we kind of have to follow suit.

title: Fix lio_listio resubmission with Tokio 1.13.0 and later
body:
According to @darksonn there have never been a guarantee that a future
will get poll()'d a second time if you do not call poll_ready() a second
time after it previously returned Poll::Ready.  But due to a bug in
Tokio 1.12.0 and earlier we got away with it.  Fix it the right way, and
update the Tokio dependency now that the PollAio stuff is merged.

Fixes #27
